37835829.review:
Like many reviews here, I first saw this during a LoadingReadyRun's Watch + Play Stream and still enjoying it now.

Executes a simple premise, control scheme and art style with tact. It then build layers of complexity though clever use varied enemies, upgrades and secrets, well into your triple figure tries. Completed by a soundtrack that never grates or imposes and you get a well round experience.

Worth every bit.

37003705.review: This game is great. You should get it.

36242530.review:
Really nice little arena based FPS with short intense action, persistent weapon upgrades which combines with learning the game and the enemies to make a nice smooth difficulty curve to work your way up as you improve your gameplay and your arsenal to enable your expeditions to last longer.

Your task is to drop into a crater and follow around your automated mining robot (FRAND) and pick up the gold he mines from the crater (and the occasional gold from the gold coloured skeltins that sometimes appear). The main thing that really makes the game is the greed mechanic - the first gold you pick up is worth 5, the next is worth 6 (for 11 total), then 7 (=>18) and so on. However if you die before depositing this gold back in the middle of the arena where you started, you get nothing, so you have to balance the risk of losing everything to the every increasing rewards for staying out longer.

As your expeditions last longer more enemy types appear, each with their own gimmick (green skeltins explode when you kill them, which is good, red skeltins move very fast, which is very bad, etc.), but the key is all of them can be killed by one shot (except maybe the boss at the end which I haven't reached), so the difficulty is in numbers and the special abilities some have, which I always find much more rewarding to prevail against than just endless amounts of tanky enemies that you need to empty entire clips to kill each one.

Another nice touch is the start menu - instead of being in a traditional menu system, all the features you would normally find in a game menu are laid out on the interior of the ship, so to turn the in game music off or to a different track, you go over to the radio, or to upgrade weapons you go to the upgrade machine in the other corner, and to start a game you drop through the hole in the floor down to the crater. You even have some motivational posters in there which explain the key mechanics of the game you might otherise miss (how the gold system works, why wraiths appear, how to kill the ball enemies in one shot).

The only down side I really found was once gold is no longer useful and you have no more upgrades to buy it takes away quite a lot of what this game work so well, but before then you will probably have a good few evenings blasting skeltins and being run over by balls while chasing after that big score.

Overall this is highly recommended, and is perfectly suited to lots of short five minute gaming sessions whenever you get time, or longer "just one more expedition, I promise I won't get too greedy this time"

I roughly measure games by a a pound (sterling) per hour. I suspect I'll get 10 hours + out of this. The music is great, the aesthetic is ridiculous, the challenge is demanding and I can see myself already getting better, the upgrading is enjoyable, and overall I'm just going to blow the hell out of the freaky skull bastards in this crater or die trying (one milliion times).

30328206.review:
Do you enjoy Devil Daggers? Buy this game.

Are you a fan of great, catchy, simple background music? Buy this game.

Do you have the price of a starbucks small coffee burning a hole in your steam wallet? Do it.

If you have any love for FPS, you can and should give this a try. There's very little to lose in buying it and you're supporting what I feel is a very promising new developer who had a great iteration on a classic arena/horde shooter on their hands, and then took those mechanics and pumped every single crevice they could find with so much charm that the end result came out watertight and bulletproof.

Like many others I caught this on the VOD of Watch+Play, and I was thrilled to see just how well everything fit together. And so I want to address the next part of this to the Developer personally: You've done incredible work in the Unity personal engine, and while it suffers a tiny bit from being made in that engine, you made what minor annoyances there were part of the game's aesthetic. Please continue to develop for this game, as there currently is a definite point where a person playing it will run out of things to buy and at that point their interest may drop off. For its price, it is absolutely a finished product, but it feels like the enjoyability of the later stages of play time could be increased.

And even if you don't, please continue making games. I'll have my eye pinned on any new projects on the horizon coming from this studio, and others would be fools not to do the same.

29810406.review:
Like many reviewers here, I saw this game first as a palate cleanser on LoadingReadyRun's Watch and Play, and bought the game during the stream. I have to say that it is well worth the £2.79, and indeed that I'd consider paying up to £6 for the provided experience. Atomic 79 is a fantastic Devil Daggers-esque arena runner where you follow your trusty mining robot (adorably designated F.R.A.N.D) around a dark crater to collect the gold it digs up, all the while avoiding and shooting the nefarious "Skeltins" that one-hit kill you if they reach your position.

Though seemingly simplistic, the game has a lot of well-designed hidden depth that enriches the experience. Gold pickups' point value is incremented based on how much gold you are already carrying without depositing it, meaning the more gold you're willing to risk, the more you get. Strong, fast enemies spawn if the regular enemy spawn limit is reached, punishing the player for playing defensively and merely avoiding the Skeltins. The player's secondary weapon (a grenade) recharges its use based on enemies killed since it was last used, rewarding aggressive play again. All the weapons (including the grenade) can be upgraded with gold collected, and helpful posters around the starting area appear as features are encountered, explaining how to deal with them.

Also of note is the fantastic soundtrack by Aeronaut, which is consistently entertaining. Overall, Atomic 79 is a great game for either long or short play: a run generally takes under 5 minutes, though I find myself chaining runs together for over an hour at a time. The price is almost trivial, and great value for the received content, and I recommend everybody with an interest in roguelites, arena runners, voxel art, cute robots, neat electronic tunes, cool and well thought-out game mechanics, moon craters, and feelings of horror and impending doom as the grenade one threw illuminates the hordes of enemies ready to replace those caught in its blast check this game out.

29798167.review:
Bought this after watching LoadingReadyRun play it on their stream, definitely worth the money.
The game looks great, the design of F.R.A.N.D. is really cute and the overall aethetic really achieves the look of a game that is fun and fast paced. Gameplay wise, it manages to achieve constant tension over whether you'll be able to get back to bank the gold but doesn't become overbearing.
Great game, hope to see more in future.

29776426.review:
As someone who puts hundreds of hours on a good rogue-like, this is the best... rogue-lite? I don't know the terminology. Whatever. It's the best game in the last 10 months. However it doesn't have 300 hours worth of potential play like some in the genre. I hope there's more coming down the pipe from this developer, either updates for this game, or more games.

This is fun. Buy it.

29734104.review: Kind of like Devil Daggers but with more in depth progression and options. For four dollars this is a no brainer.

29732415.review:
This is an amazing little arena shooter. 

So, you're a person with a robot in a cursed crater in space. Possibly on the moon? The gravity is low, so the controls take some getting used to. I don't think they're bad, they just make your character feel like you have momentum. 
Your robot is mining gold from the crater for you, and your job is to get the gold back to your base, while defending yourself from an onslaught of skeltins, skells and worse. There's a really clever greed mechanic that gives you more gold for waiting longer to deposit in in the bank, with the obvious penalty of losing everything you're carrying if you die. It's absolutely gotten me several times, but it's just so tempting ... 
Anyway, it's difficult, but with the persistent upgrade system, you feel like you're actually progressing. I don't know what the endgame is, the longest I've been able to live is just over 3 minutes. I know I'm going to have fun finding out. 

So, other things. 
This game feels like it's tuned to make you grin, even while it's kicking your teeth down your throat. From the little informational posters in your base//office to the voxel-cute enemies  (except the bone balls. those things are freaky) the whole thing feels like it's got an great sense of humor. 
The sound design is solid, and the music is very good. (OST DLC PLS?) I think it might get repetitive at some point, but I haven't lived long enough for that yet. 

This game is great, the price is insane. If you like this kind of game just buy it. Don't wait for a sale, buy it. It's $4. You can afford that. Buy it.

29728126.review: Incredible fun for only $4 US. Get it now! Would love to see an update or and expanded sequel, just for a few more weapons and maybe another map or two, but as it is it's still got a lot of replay value due to the challenge.

29263900.review:
(Note: I received a copy of this game for free. I also tested it during development. My time played on Steam is not indicative of how much I actually played this game.)

Let me start by saying this is not typically a style of game I get a lot of enjoyment out of. I'm a pretty casual gamer, and as such, games that punish me are usually a huge turn-off. I tend to play them long enough to discover I suck at them, then never play them again.

That being said, I frickin [b]love[/b] this game. It makes me mad, but in such a way that I become determined and [i]have[/i] to play one more round. It's the perfect combination of simple gameplay and punishing difficulty. The music is catchy and keeps me amped, but doesn't overstay it's welcome. The 3D-pixel-art visual style is a nice mix of retro and modern. The setting and enemies are unique and have a weird, spooky cuteness to them. I particularly like the small range of visibility. Enemies seem to walk out of the darkness at you from every angle. Every death scares the bejeezus out of me and usually sends me into a fit of rage-laughter.

My only real complaint is that I can't seem to buy upgrades as quickly as I want to, but that is 100% attributed to my skill level. And I can sort of understand complaints about the sort of slippery-feeling controls, but after a few trips to the pit, I adjusted and no longer noticed it. It seemed appropriate to me, given that the game is set in spooky space.

I would definitely recommend this game to anyone that likes gauntlet-style games, especially shooters. While I received this game for free, I do think the price is ridiculously reasonable. It's hard to find a game this good looking and fun for less than five bucks!

29263703.review:
A fun little game that is pretty hard at times. A first person bullet hell game, similar to Devil Daggers but this has some progression between runs. Most runs don't last too long so it has that "just one more turn" feel to it. The music is good if you enjoy chiptune music. I enjoy the gold mechanic in the game where the more gold you pick up without deposting it, the more each pick up is worth. It brings a unique "how greedy can you be and get away with it" mechanic. 

The only potentially bad things I can think of for people is that UI for the weapon menu is kind of confusing at first since it is all in game and aiming at the computer console on the ship and that the enemy spawns are RNG based. These aren't necessarily bad things for everyone, the UI is a preference thing that I don't really mind but can see people having issues with. The RNG spawns keep things interesting instead of just memorizing when things spawn but can end a run if you're particularly unlucky.

29261186.review: So spooky but so good. Great little survival game with a good sense of progression.

29242520.review:
Its a fun and interesting take on shooters with a different kind of "Pixel" style. I'm not a huge fan of the music like everyone else is, but that's just me and my taste in music. It does not get repetative or annoying as you play. What is annoying to me is just how frequently the skeletons spawn. And in tandem with that I'd say the collison with the dozens of fallen skeletons can be deadly if you don't notice them. Although I don't think that's a bad thing since who wouldn't be stumbling trying to walk on hundreds of various bones?
I feel like the game will be much easier and more exciting the more you progress and gain more weapons. You DEFINITELY have to keep moving or die in seconds since the mobs will spawn where everywhere you can't see. 
The game is not without its quirks and bumps, but I think if the developers work little bits on the game it can be something great.

29239757.review: This game is so great! I spent my night playing it. I have read some of the reviews complaining about the movement. It is not hard to get used it and it makes since since the game is in space. It is difficult and I usually hate rage inducing games. This one makes me want to not stop playing til I get farther! I definitely think you should check it out!

29239756.review: Easy to pick up quickly and get enjoyment out of. Art design is cute, and controls feel pretty intuitive. Uses the basic WASD keyboard scheme for movement, which I personally prefer. Tutorial and game info is incorporated in a clever way as well.

29238769.review:
I honestly don't understand the complaints I'm seeing about the controls being "slippy." It's a physics based game, and as such you accelerate and decelerate, but they don't feel slippy to me. Like all games, it took a few runs to get a feel for it, but honestly within 5-10 minutes it felt pretty natural.

The music is top-notch, and goes through a really nice loop. A lot of times I find myself getting irritated with songs in games where you continually start over repeatedly, but so far I haven't gotten sick of it. I also really enjoy the speed at which the difficulty ramps up. It takes a minute or two to really get going, which feels like just the right amount of time to warm up and get into the flow. The art style is also super cute! It manages to be both dark and super colorful at the same time, and I love the design of the "spooky" skeletons.

The only complaint I really have is that there's a pretty limited selection of weapons to choose from, though it seems pretty obvious that this is meant to be just a small, quick, fun little game, and as such isn't overflowing with content like that. For the price, I feel like it's totally worth it, especially if you like the "challenging, insta-death" genre.

29237945.review: This game is fun in burst and makes me wanna come back and improve for better stuff. Overall it gets an A from me.

29237484.review: Enjoyable take on the arena shooter genre/ horde mode kind of game. A little disappointing that air strafing isn't a thing but not difficult to get used to. 10/10 would suggest.

29236815.review: Simple concept, fun gameplay, and an amazing soundtrack. What more can you want from an indie shooter?

29230872.review:
Fair warning, I am one of the testers, but in the event my review seems at all biased, I'd like to point out that I would not have continued testing the game if it was one that I did not enjoy to play.


Pros:

-Simple, easy to pick up and play concept.
-Good system of progression. New weapons exist not to make the game easier (as each new weapon comes with it's shares of weaknesses to balance out it's benefits), but to add variety to the gameplay.
-Fantastic soundtrack by Aethernaut.
-Charming art design.
-Light, easy gameplay quickly becomes difficult and chaotic about 2 minutes in, providing a nice challenge after a decent length warm up. 
-Time consuming achievements. Some may see this as a con, but I see it as an excuse to keep me playing the game until I can 100% it, and as a general rule of thumb, if a game can keep you playing it, it's doing something right.
-Quick rounds of gameplay. I like that I can queue up for a dungeon in a game and then play a few rounds of this while I wait out my timer.
-Moon physics. The game adds some additional difficulty through use of low gravity/friction. It's a bit difficult at first, but once you have it figured out it adds satisfaction to being able to navigate your way through a swarm of skeles. 

Cons:

-Some minor movement issues. While the moon physics don't bother me, I find myself dying a lot due to getting stuck on skele corpses and having my speed drastically slow down. While that does add some realism, it's somewhat frustrating to lose 100g because you get stuck on a body.
-Lack of controller support. This is a minor issue, and I can understand it being difficult to enable since I tried to juryrig it using DS4Windows and it failed horribly (the right thumbstick could not come close to matching the sensitivity of the mouse movement).

All in all, an enjoyable experience. It does have it's flaws, but they're all minor and can be worked around with practice.

29226242.review:
Shoot, dodge, survive. And, yknow, get the gold (which I am particularily bad at, apparently.) Simple as it may sound, this game has a lot of creatures that want nothing more than your head as a trophy on the wall. Hyperdeath with a touch of bullet hell, this game is great fun. 

Movement takes some getting used to, but it's in space, it's gonna be a bit weird to jump and move.

29222805.review:
一款简单无脑射击游戏，游戏本体为求精简甚至将升级,教程以及退出都集成在关卡里，如果想要开始只需跳进伸手不见五指的大坑即可。魔性且节奏感的音乐是游戏唯一的亮点，紧随其后的便是糟糕的太空式移动操作，roguelike一般的难度和毫无深度的内容体验，16元的价格虽然没什么太多要求，但我希望这16元能提供更多的体验。
也许这个游戏是为挂卡而生，首发原价入手不是个明智的选择。

29220178.review: Fun little game, has a good edge of difficulty but the movements a bit slippy and I have a hard time managing that with an uncountable legion of skeltins coming at me at every angle.
